extracted-table.table-caption: Demographic and clinical characteristics of migraine in the VBM studies.

caption.p: Demographic and clinical characteristics of migraine in the VBM studies.

tr.td: The technique details and main findings.

Increased: right amygdala and right putamen, left putamen, right pallidum, right hippocampus, right PHG, right superior parietal lobule, left insula, right cerebellum, left superior occipital gyrus and cuneus
Decreased: frontal lobe, right angular gyrus.
Increased: bilateral cerebellar culmen, lingual gyrus, thalamus, fusiform and PHG
Increased: right superior parietal gyrus and left thalamus
Decreased: right cerebellum, left postcentral and precentral gyrus, right inferior frontal gyrus, and left lingual gyrus
Decreased: bilateral superior and inferior colliculus, PAG, LC, median raphe nuclei (MRN) and dorsal pons medulla
Decreased: ACC, bilateral dlPFC, left hippocampus/PHG
Decreased: right PCG, left precentral gyrus, and cerebellum
Decreased: superior temporal areas and postcentral gyrus

table-wrap-foot.p: ACC, anterior cingulate cortex; MWA, migraine with aura; MWoA, migraine without aura; EM, episodic migraine; CM, chronic migraine; FWHM, full width at half maximum; GRF, Gaussian random field theory; FEW, family wise error; FDR, false detect rate; SVC, small volume correction; mM, menstrual migraine; LF, low frequency; HF, high frequency; PAG, periaqueductal gray; LC, locus ceruleus; MRN, median raphe nuclei; dlPFC, bilateral dorsolateral prefrontal cortex; PHG, parahippocampal gyrus; ICHD-3 beta, international classification of headache disorders, 3rd edition (beta version); PCG, postcentral gyrus; HIS, international headache society; MTG, middle temporal gyrus; OFC, orbitofrontal cortex; T, Tesla; VBM, voxel-based morphometry.

extracted-table.table-caption: Demographic and clinical characteristics of FC studies in migraine.

caption.p: Demographic and clinical characteristics of FC studies in migraine.

tr.td: Technique details and main findings of included FC studies.
Increased: left MFG, posterior cingulate and precuneus
Decreased: bilateral occipital lobes, right AI and basal ganglia

Decreased: left occipital gyrus, bilateral cuneus, bilateral parietal lobules, bilateral postcentral gyrus, bilateral dorsolateral prefrontal gyrus, pons, bilateral cerebellar posterior lobes, right paracentral lobule, right middle cingulate gyrus and bilateral SMA
Decreased: left precentral gyrus, left MFG, left inferior parietal gyrus, bilateral middle temporal gyrus, right SFG, right SMA, right inferior frontal gyrus and medial SFG
Decreased: left precuneus, supramarginal gyrus and ITG
Increased: the frontal lobe, the caudate nucleus, and the THA
Decreased: temporal lobe, parietal lobe, cingulate gyrus, precuneus, PHG, and caudate nucleus
Increased: bilateral SMA/PCL, right postcentral gyrus, left orbitofrontal gyrus and fusiform gyrus, bilateral temporal pole, and cerebellum
Decreased: bilateral angular gyrus, mPFC, hippocampus/PHG, middle/inferior temporal gyrus, left temporal pole, right cerebellum and brainstem
Decreased: right hippocampus and bilateral ACC
Decreased: left precuneus, right IPL and right MFG
Increased: left cerebellum, right LG, left inferior frontal gyrus
Decreased: bilateral STG and right precentral gyrus
Increased: right PCC/precuneus, left MFG and left ITG

fn.p: The unit is month; CM, chronic migraine; EM, episodic migraine; MWA, migraine with aura; MWoA, migraine without aura; MWoA-A, migraine without aura with anxiety; MWoA-OA, migraine without aura and anxiety.

table-wrap-foot.p: ACC: anterior cingulate cortex; AI: anterior insula; aMCC: anterior midcingulate; ADN: anterior dorsal thalamic nucleus; FC: functional connectivity; GMM: Gaussian Mixture Modeling; GMM: Gaussian Mixture Modeling GRF: Gaussian random field; IPL: inferior parietal lobule; IHS: International Headache Society; ITG: inferior temporal gyrus; LG: lingual gyrus; LGN: lateral geniculate nucleus; MCC: middle cingulum cortex; MFG: middle frontal gyrus; MOG: middle occipital gyrus; mPFC: medial prefrontal cortex; MPC: midline posterior cingulate; MRN: median raphe nuclei; MrD: marginal division of neostriatum; NA: not available; NCF: nucleus cuneiformis; OFC: orbitofrontal cortex; PAG: periaqueductal gray; PCC: posterior cingulate cortex; PCL: paracentral lobule; PHG: parahippocampal gyrus; RN: red nucleus; SFG: superior frontal gyrus; SMA: supplementary motor area; SN: substantia nigra; STG: superior temporal gyrus; THA: thalamus; VPN: ventral posterior nucleus.

Increased: bilateral thalamus, IFG, MOG, left insula, caudate, MFG, MTG, IOG, right ACC, MeFG, superior temporal gyrus, bilateral ACC, amygdala, thalamus, caudate, lentiform nucleus, uncus, SFG, temporal pole, cerebellum, brain stem, left hippocampus

Decreased: putamen, brainstem, thalamus, temporal cortex, and cerebellum, OFC, secondary somatosensory cortex

Decreased: bilateral S1 and the right PMC
Increased: PAG, hypothalamus, and somatosensory thalamus
